content: I was curioud as to what exact symptoms allowed you to collect the benifit. This being for a child of a soldier exposed to agent orange and inherited some conditions as a result. The people collecting benifits do not have to have been in the service at all.The benifit is for medical problems caused by inheratence of agent orange contamination. Hope this makes sense. -Del

content: This is not research for myself. It is for someone I know. I was in the Army and am 80% disabled through VA. My condition has nothing to do with agent orange. The friend does have symptoms of something and has not ever been in the military. The father was exposed to agent orange and trying to get his benifits even today. He keeps getting turned down. Knowing that children can collect benifits from inherited issues due to agent orange he wants my friend to try and get benifits for thier conditon. I am just trying to see what conditions has made this possible for others to do if they have. As far as the Bio goes. You can find me on many different message bords under the name mrdel or mr_del. I have not filled out a bio in any of them. I guess it has to do with my bipolar. Google can bring up all my posts I ever made. The mr_del name is not in use only by me thats why I changed it to mrdel. -Del
